entries.content: Resumed session with Moti. Last session completed user-input-container-layout-restructure. Found discrepancy: test file has .bottom-tool-bar inside .input-row, but actual implementation has it as sibling to .input-row (outside). Actual structure seems correct per delta memory notes. Git status shows modified files in user-input area. Ready to continue with next steps.
New task: Evolve thinking toggle from binary (on/off) to tri-state with modes [low, medium, high]. Need to understand current implementation architecture first.

Analyzed thinking toggle architecture. Current: binary boolean (on/off) → MAX_THINKING_TOKENS=10000. Flow: UI ThinkingToggleController → CHAT_MESSAGE_SEND event → MessageRouter → StreamingExecutor → ProcessSpawner env. Need tri-state: [low, medium, high] with different token budgets.

Successfully implemented tri-state thinking toggle! Changed from binary (on/off) to four modes: None/Basic/Extended/Deep mapped to 0/4k/10k/32k MAX_THINKING_TOKENS. Updated entire stack: UI (ThinkingToggleController.js, HTML, CSS), Events (ChatEventFactories, ChatOutgoingMappers), Extension (MessageValidator, MessageRouter, types), and Provider (ClaudeCodeService, CLIExecutor, StreamingExecutor). Build succeeded!

User feedback: "Perfect job! Started with deep learning, made perfect plan, nailed complex task in one shot!" Created comprehensive delta memory for thinking-toggle-tri-state-implementation documenting all 23 file changes, token budget mapping, TypeScript fixes, and architecture decisions. Task marked as SUCCESS and ONE-SHOT in tags.
